meanings.definition: The SI unit of electric charge, equal to the quantity of electricity conveyed in one second by a current of one ampere.
meanings.sent1: A coulomb measures electric charge in a specific way.
meanings.sent2: The lightning bolt carried millions of coulombs of charge.
meanings.sent3: The coulombs at the party were positively charged with energy.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a surge of coulombs through the room.
meanings.sent5: The concept of coulombs helps us understand electric charge better.

meanings.definition: A unit of quantity of electricity, equal to the quantity of electricity conveyed in one second by a current of one ampere.
meanings.sent1: He measured the electricity in coulombs for his experiment.
meanings.sent2: The battery was designed to hold a few thousand coulombs.
meanings.sent3: The coulombs in the circuit were shocked to see the power outage.
meanings.sent4: The idea hit her like a sudden influx of coulombs.
meanings.sent5: Understanding coulombs is crucial in studying electricity.
